page.title: 16GIRDLENESS LIGHTHOUSE 2
page.content: is subject to the notorious sea haar. This fog sweeps in off the sea often during warm,sunny weather smothering the town in a cold,grey dank blanket. Then the sound of 'Moanin Minnie', the lighthouse's foghorn is regularily heard bellowing across Aberdeen Bay and in parts of the city as well as far out to sea.It is also commonly heard during the winter months. If one is standing too close at the time the noise is deafening and one can feel the ground and buildings vibrate. The land to the rear, now part of the Walker Park, was originally granted to the lighthouse-keeper to graze his herd of cows on. Unlike many of the lighthouses today this one has not been automated and there is still a lighthouse-keeper who occassionaly shows visitors round.
